Posts.Content: HollyG wrote: I was told yesterday, after more mammo pics and an ultrasound that I have a 1cm spiculated assymetrical density with possible architectural distortion.  I am to see a surgeon tomorrow, then have a stereotactic biopsy.  I am scared beyond belief that I have breast cancer.  Any advise? Posts.Title: Terrified HollyG Pickles

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2010 08:26AM HollyG wrote: Right now it is 0-Incomplete, needs additional imaging (this is from my mammo last week).  I don't know what is was from yesterday, yet.  I should find out tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Terrified HollyG Pickles

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2010 05:13AM HollyG wrote: Thank you Ladies for all of this great support.  I am at work this morning waiting to go in, and my mind is just not here, but it's better than being at home for now.  I'll post more this afternoon.  Thanks again! Holly
Posts.Title: Terrified HollyG Pickles

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2010 10:39AM HollyG wrote: My results from Tuesday were: Assymetric density and architectural distortion central left breast at approx 12:00 position.  Bi-rads 4.  I am waiting for the breast center to call me back for the biopsy, she thinks she can get me in tomorrow, but has to check it with the MD........
Posts.Title: Terrified HollyG Pickles

Posts.Content: May 2, 2010 06:55AM HollyG wrote: Well, on Friday, they did not do the biopsy.  The radiologist there wanted more mammo views, then another ultrasound, and he said they were "inconclusive".   So I am going in for a Molecular Breast Imaging on Tuesday.....I was happy to not go through the biopsy on Friday, but more waiting stinks....guess we wait to see what we can find out on Friday.  Any thoughts on this??
Posts.Title: Terrified HollyG Pickles

Posts.Content: May 5, 2010 05:43AM HollyG wrote: Well I had the MBI yesterday, and the radiologist told me it is not cancer!!  Thank God!  There seems to be something wrong with a milk duct.  I will follow up with my surgeon on Friday, and see what, if anything will be done.  Thank you all for the support, and good thoughts.  What a terrifying time in my life.  It is nice to know these sites are out here for us.  Good luck to you and prayers for healing!  Thank you!!
Posts.Title: Terrified HollyG Pickles

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2010 08:00AM HollyG wrote: Hi Pickles~ Right now I am doctoring in Red Wing (I work there), but will have the biopsy at Fairview Southdale.  Quickly seems to be the word!  I cannot stand this waiting and worrying.  Thanks for the healing thoughts!  18 mos ago I had a scare, but both ended up being a cyst in each breast.  This is far more terrifying.  Anything you have to say would help.  What was your original reason for bringing you back?  What was your diagnosis?
